poem:
"Of the Cosmos and the Quiet"

The sky is a hypocrisy; a jovial dance
Of twinkling lies. A daunting hole, they tell -
Vast in its silence, weighty in its empty magnitude.
No sun's warmth lent, just a cold celestial pull.
Aquila weeps, bound tethered in stellar waltz,
A dance macabre, only 2,000 light years from our petty selves.
In space, as in hearts, lie hidden chasms deep.
